p: The concentration-dependent effect (R 2) values were calculated for each bacterial species accordingly, R 2 of 80% methanolic extract was 0.873, 0.890, 0.930 and 0.987, for ATCC strain of S. typhi, E. coli, P. aeruginosa and S. flexneri respectively. The maximum average zone of inhibition was recorded at 800 mg/mL concentration of test extract as 22.0, 20.7, 19.3 and 18.3 mm for ATCC strains of P. aeruginosa, S. flexneri, S. typhi and E. coli respectively. On the contrary, no bacterial growth inhibition was observed in all concentrations of 80% methanolic extract against clinical isolates of E. coli and Salmonella species.
